newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil's real drops 0.28 pct on dollar outflows.
newsitem.headline: Brazil's real drops 0.28 pct on dollar outflows.

text.p: Brazil's real on Monday fell 0.28 percent to close at 1.0905 per dollar on outflows of the U.S. currency in the commercial foreign exchange market, dealers said.
Preliminary figures for commercial and financial forex contracts at 1640 local/1940 GMT showed a $85 million deficit, dealers added.

They said that Monday was unlikely to show positive figures at the end of the day, as occurred Friday, when the market initially expected a net dollar outflows but forex contracts posted a $9.4 million surplus.
"But to push the real lower you do not need a strong dollar outflow because the stock of dollars is low," one trader said.
Despite the $3.9 billion surplus accumulated so far this month, the stock of dollars in the market is very low because of previous central bank dollar buy auctions, dealers said.
They said the real would remain under pressure until a strong dollar inflow increases the supply of dollars in the market.
In the interbank floating rate market, the real closed at 1.0905 per dollar, up 0.11 percent, amid dollar inflows, traders said.
In the parallel market, the real rose 0.44 percent to end at 1.135 per dollar.
